actions.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.
Received in the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.

actions.committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

actions.text: Unfavorable Executive Comment Received from State.

actions.text: Executive Comment Received from Education.

actions.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee (Amended).

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Education and Labor
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported (Amended).
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Education and Labor. H. Rept. 101-517.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 314.
Mr. Williams moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Mr. Goodling demanded a second on the motion to suspend the rules.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
On ordering a second Agreed to without objection.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendments to Senate bill.
Senate agreed to the House amendments by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 101-324.

official_title: A bill to amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to clarify the administrative procedures of the National Commission on Responsibilities for Financing Postsecondary Education.
subjects: Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands

summary.text: Amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to add provisions for the administration of the National Commission on Responsibilities for Financing Postsecondary Education. Terminates the Commission two years after the first meeting of its members (rather than, as now, two years after their initial appointment).

titles.title: A bill to amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to clarify the administrative procedures of the National Commission on Responsibilities for Financing Postsecondary Education.
